oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Lumber mill in Pine Top
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Black and white photograph of a lumber mill in Pine Top that supplied the wood for Western State Hospital. This mill was once owned by the Ross family. Several unidentified men and boys can be seen standing by the mill, on right. Text towards the top of the photograph reads: "timber was used in construction of Western State Hospital," and text towards the bottom of the photograph reads: "This mill sawed the logs for Western State Hospital. The Rosses had the first planer mill in Hardeman County."
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: People; Children; Lumber industry; Mills
